name: GI JOE 12" Air Adventurer/Kung-Fu Grip (Hot Topic Exclusive)
description:
Back in December of 2006, Hasbro teamed up with Hot Topic to release a reproduction of the classic Adventure Team Land Adventurer. Classic 12 inch GI Joe's came in what has become known as the “coffin” box. It was named as such because the long cardboard box is just the right size to fit Joe inside. In that way, it resembles a coffin.

For the Stickler: The figure has never been removed from the box and is still factory wired to the plastic insert. The box seal was opened but the figure is unused.

name: Game Boy Printer
description:
The Original Nintendo Game Boy Printer. This is a thermal printer designed for the Game Boy and Game Boy Color, almost never used, still has a roll of paper, looks brand new! 

Tech Talk: The Game Boy Printer was released in 1998. It prints images from compatible games on small rolls of thermal paper. Individual sheets are adhesive-backed and 3.8 cm (1.5 in) in diameter. The Game Boy Printer uses six AA batteries. It is compatible with all Game Boy models except for the Game Boy micro. A Link cable is required to connect the printer to a Game Boy. Nintendo stopped manufacturing the Game Boy Printer in 2003.
